Locally
productive,
globally connected
cities

Until cities produce everything they consume.

Currently, cities occupy 2% of the earth's surface to house 1/2 of world population

The are responsible for 67% of global energy consumption

and 70% of global waste generation

in 2050, it is expected that 2/3 of the global population will live in cities.

We are shifting the paradigm PITO to DIDO to enable cities to produce everything they consume by 2054

Fab City Challenge

Fab City Global Initiative challenges the current industrial paradigm of Product-in Trash-out, by advocating for the return of manufacture to cities supported by a Data-in Data-out urban model. It comprises a network of 28 cities, a core team of collective members and is governed by a foundation, all working to change the urban paradigm of yesterday, and make the cities of tomorrow.

Read the

White Paper

Values & Vision

We manifest our values and vision as a community of practice.

Our Approach

We apply our vision and values in a full stack model. From the local to the global, we work across multiple layers of practice and deployment, scaling the FabLab approach to a city and systems level.

See the

Full Stack

Common knowledge

As a global network, we are connected through the knowledge we share, across common tools and platforms.

A global initiative

Fab City Network

Core to the initiative is a network of cities, regions and countries that have pledged to work towards producing everything they consume by 2054. Citizens, FabLabs and City officials collaborate locally to implement new urban models through interventions in governance and policy.

  • Barcelona
  • Zagreb
  • Bhutan
  • Shenzhen
  • Georgia
  • Curitiba
  • Occitanie Region
  • Puebla
  • Mexico City
  • Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
  • Amsterdam
  • Cambridge
  • Kerala
  • Sacramento

Fab City Foundation

Fab City was founded by key partners in 2014. In 2018 the Fab City Foundation was founded.

Governance

Model

Join

Citizens, communities, spaces, machines & tools

We collaborate with experts and enthusiasts to share the potential of productivity in cities through research, internships, FabLabs, partnerships, workshops and toolkits.

EMAIL

Join your city to the Fab City Network

We welcome new member cities once a year at the annual Fab City event. To see the process and your eligibility, take our quiz!

Quiz

Prototype the city

We engage in action-research directly in the city by prototyping and deploying strategies across localities in our network.

Fab City Collective

Ambassadors of the Fab City vision. Researching, developing and implementing the Fab City values and strategic vision.
